skill.name: chatkit-widget
skill.description:
Use when integrating OpenAI/ChatKit chat widgets into Next.js/React applications.
Triggers for: embedding chat widgets, configuring widget appearance, implementing event handlers,
setting up authenticated chat access, or customizing widget branding.
NOT for: building custom chat UIs from scratch or backend AI model configuration.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown guidance and a Python validation script. The verify.py script only reads SKILL.md for validation purposes and has no network, command execution, or sensitive data access capabilities.

content.value_statement: Need to add a chat widget to your Next.js or React application? This skill provides expert guidance for embedding ChatKit widgets with secure configuration, role-based access, and custom branding support.
actual_capabilities: Embed ChatKit chat widgets in Next.js App Router and Pages Router
Configure widget appearance with custom colors, positioning, and branding
Implement role-based chat access control for different user types
Create secure API proxies to protect ChatKit secret keys
Add lazy loading for optimal page performance
Integrate dark mode support for themed chat experiences
limitations: Does not build custom chat UIs from scratch
Does not configure backend AI models or ChatKit server settings
Does not provide the actual ChatKit widget runtime library
Does not include authentication implementation beyond session integration

prompt_templates.title: Basic widget setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the chatkit-widget skill to add a ChatKit chat widget to my Next.js application. Configure it with my project ID and public key from environment variables.

prompt_templates.title: Custom styling
prompt_templates.prompt: Use chatkit-widget to customize the chat widget with our company colors and logo. Set primary color to #2563EB and add a custom welcome message.

prompt_templates.title: Role-based access
prompt_templates.prompt: Use chatkit-widget to implement role-based chat access. Only show the widget to authenticated users with student or teacher roles.

prompt_templates.title: API proxy
prompt_templates.prompt: Use chatkit-widget to create a secure API proxy for ChatKit that protects our secret key and prevents invalid endpoint access.

output_examples.input: Add ChatKit widget to my Next.js app with school branding
output: 1. Create config/chatkit.config.ts with your project settings
3. Include LazyChatWidget in your root layout.tsx
5. Configure CHATKIT_SECRET_KEY for server-side API proxy

best_practices: Keep secret keys in server-only environment variables (CHATKIT_SECRET_KEY) and never expose them to the client.
Use lazy loading with dynamic imports and ssr: false to prevent hydration errors and improve performance.
Validate all API proxy endpoints against an allowlist to prevent server-side request forgery attacks.
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys or secrets in component code or configuration files.
Loading the chat widget on every page without checking user roles or page visibility.
Passing user PII (personally identifiable information) to the widget without proper consent and sanitization.

faq.question: What platforms work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Next.js (App Router and Pages Router), React 18+, and supports integration with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: Can I customize the widget appearance?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill shows how to customize colors, fonts, border radius, positioning, and create custom themes for dark mode.

faq.question: How do I secure my ChatKit credentials?
faq.answer: Store secret keys in CHATKIT_SECRET_KEY (server-only) and use NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefixed variables only for public keys. Create an API proxy for server-side calls.

faq.question: Is user data safe with this integration?
faq.answer: The skill includes role-based access control and recommends minimal event logging. Ensure your ChatKit instance complies with your privacy policy requirements.

faq.question: Why is the widget not loading?
faq.answer: Check that NEXT_PUBLIC_CHATKIT_PROJECT_ID is set correctly, verify browser console for errors, and ensure the widget script URL is accessible from your deployment.

faq.question: How does this compare to building a custom chat UI?
faq.answer: This skill uses the official ChatKit widget for faster deployment. Building custom provides full control but requires significantly more development time and maintenance.
